steps.title: Lay down newspapers on your workspace.
steps.content: Lay down newspapers on your workspace. Make sure that the newspaper covers your entire workspace. If you are worried about the newspaper sliding out of place, tape it down. Use 2 or more layers of newspaper if you are messy.

steps.title: Pour the acrylic paint(s) of your choice onto a paint palette.
steps.content: Pour the acrylic paint(s) of your choice onto a paint palette. Squirt a grape-sized dollop of each color around the edges of the palette. Keep the colors separate, with about 1 inch (2.5 cm) in between each one. If you want to mix colors, pour a little of each color into one divot and mix with a separate brush. [1] X Research source Use a paper plate if you don’t have a paint palette. Don’t pour out too much paint!

steps.title: Use a pencil to outline a design on your mug.
steps.content: Use a pencil to outline a design on your mug. Pencil graphite is the perfect outlining tool because it glides easily on the mug and can be erased. Keep your pencil design off of the mug’s lip. [2] X Research source Use painter’s tape to help you draw straight lines. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Brush the first layer of paint on the mug and let it dry.
steps.content: Brush the first layer of paint on the mug and let it dry. Dip your brush in water and dry it on a paper towel. Then, dip it in the acrylic paint color of your choice. Take the paintbrush and paint whatever you want! Just make sure not to paint on the mug’s lip. [4] X Research source To paint larger areas, like background color, use a thick foam brush. When painting details and smaller designs, use a thin, pointed brush. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Paint more layers until your design is complete.
steps.content: Paint more layers until your design is complete. Wait until the first layer is relatively dry before adding more. For a glossy finished look, add a top coat of clear acrylic paint. Just take a separate foam brush and lightly glide the clear acrylic over the design. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Air-dry the mug for 24 hours.
steps.content: Air-dry the mug for 24 hours. Place your mug on a piece of newspaper and store it in a safe place. Try not to touch the mug when it’s drying! Doing so can lengthen the drying time and mess up the paint. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Clean-up your design with an eraser and or rubbing alcohol.
steps.content: Clean-up your design with an eraser and or rubbing alcohol. For paint smudges, use a cotton swab soaked in rubbing alcohol to dab at the paint until it’s gone. Move slowly when dabbing so you don’t accidentally remove part of the design you like. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Bake your mug at 350 °F (177 °C) for 35 minutes.
steps.content: Bake your mug at 350 °F (177 °C) for 35 minutes. Place the mug upright on a baking sheet. Once the oven is at 350 °F (177 °C), put the sheet in the oven. After 35 minutes, remove the mug and set it to cool completely. [9] X Research source Read your paint labels. If the label provides specific baking instructions, follow them. [10] X Research source Don’t burn yourself!

steps.title: Hand wash your mug.
steps.content: Hand wash your mug. Don’t use the dishwasher because it can mess up the paint design. Just use dish soap and warm water to rinse your mug. Once you’ve cleaned your mug, it’s ready to be put to use! [11] X Research source

steps.title: Pencil a design outline on your mug.
steps.content: Pencil a design outline on your mug. While this step isn’t necessary for paint pens, it helps keep your design clean and neat. And, if you make a mistake, you can erase it! Just make sure not to draw your design on the mug’s lip. [12] X Research source Use painter’s tape to make straight lines. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Paint pen the first layer on the mug.
steps.content: Paint pen the first layer on the mug. Use an oil-based paint marker to decorate the mug. You can follow the design you made with pencil or change it up! Just don’t use a sharpie as a replacement paint pen because it will wear off quickly. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Add more layers of paint.
steps.content: Add more layers of paint. Wait a few minutes to let the first layer of paint dry before adding. Continue adding more layers until you reach the color, thickness, and texture levels that you want. Just be careful not to mix the colors! [15] X Research source

steps.title: Erase and or rub mistakes with a rubbing alcohol soaked cotton swab.
steps.content: Erase and or rub mistakes with a rubbing alcohol soaked cotton swab. Use an eraser on leftover pencil markings. If there are stray paint marks, wait until they are dry to remove them. Then, use the rubbing alcohol soaked cotton swab to dab at the paint until it’s gone. Dry off the cotton swab before using so it isn’t dripping! [16] X Research source Work slowly and dab gently. You don’t want to accidentally erase or remove a part of the design that you like.

steps.title: Air-dry the mug for at least 24 hours.
steps.content: Air-dry the mug for at least 24 hours. Put the mug on a newspaper to dry. Don’t touch the mug while it’s drying. Doing so can elongate the drying process and mess up the design. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Bake the mug at 375 °F (191 °C) for 25 minutes.
steps.content: Bake the mug at 375 °F (191 °C) for 25 minutes. Put the mug right-side up on a baking sheet. Place the sheet and mug in the oven at 375 °F (191 °C). After 25 minutes, turn the oven off, but keep the mug in the oven for up to 2 hours. After 2 hours, remove the mug and set it to cool. [18] X Research source Use heat protection when removing the mug from the oven.

steps.title: Hand wash the mug with dish soap.
steps.content: Hand wash the mug with dish soap. Your mug is safe to wash now. However, while the dishwasher may be tempting, don’t use it. It will be too harsh on the mug and can wreck your new design! Once you clean the mug, put it to use! [19] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a Tupperware container with warm water.
steps.content: Fill a Tupperware container with warm water. Leave around 3 inches (7.6 cm) to the top of the container. The Tupperware should be deep enough to submerge your mug. If you don’t have a Tupperware, use any plastic container, big bowl, or sink. [20] X Research source The nail polish can leave a residue, so use a container you don’t care about. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Pour a few drops of nail polish in the water.
steps.content: Pour a few drops of nail polish in the water. Use as many colors as you want. Add more paint drops if the colors don’t disperse across the water. [22] X Research source Move quickly to prevent the paint from drying on the water’s surface. [23] X Research source Look at a color wheel if you are having trouble picking paint colors. It’ll show you which colors work well together.

steps.title: Swirl the paint slowly with a toothpick.
steps.content: Swirl the paint slowly with a toothpick. Hold the toothpick and swirl it in a snake, zigzag, or random pattern. Go slowly to prevent the paint from clumping. Whilst this step isn’t necessary, it helps create an effortless look. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Dip your mug in the paint design for 3 to 4 seconds.
steps.content: Dip your mug in the paint design for 3 to 4 seconds. Hold the mug straight and lower its bottom in the water. After 3 to 4 seconds, pull it out. Keep the mug straight when removing it to protect the paint design. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Air-dry the mug for 1 hour.
steps.content: Air-dry the mug for 1 hour. Place the mug on a piece of newspaper or outside to dry. To protect the design, put the mug face down. And remember not to touch it while it’s drying! [26] X Research source

steps.title: Hand wash the mug.
steps.content: Hand wash the mug. Rinse the mug using cold or hot water and dish soap. Don’t use a dishwasher because it can ruin your design. Once you’ve washed the mug, gift it, use it, or place it around your home! [27] X Research source
